thread.title: Sophie Pascoe wows in Grace Millicent Couture gown at Laureus World Sports Awards
thread.title_full: Sophie Pascoe wows in Grace Millicent Couture gown at Laureus World Sports Awards

title: Sophie Pascoe wows in Grace Millicent Couture gown at Laureus World Sports Awards
text:
Sophie Pascoe wows in Grace Millicent Couture gown at Laureus World Sports Awards Last updated 10:55, February 15 2017 Grace Millicent Couture 
Sophie Pascoe in the Grace Millicent Couture gown she wore at the Laureus World Sports Awards in Monaco. 
New Zealand's most successful paralympian Sophie Pascoe had a Cinderella moment moment in Monaco this week, where she attended the Laureus World Sports Awards. The multiple gold medal-winning swimmer was nominated for Sportsperson of the Year with a Disability award, and though she did not win (she lost out to Italian wheelchair fencer Beatrice Vio), Pascoe said she felt like a princess in her custom-designed gown. READ MORE: A post shared by Sophie Pascoe (@sophpascoe1) on Feb 14, 2017 at 8:47am PST Grace Millicent Couture 
A sketch of the stunning gown. 
The hand-crafted dress, designed by Tauranga-based boutique couture house Grace Millicent, featured layers of Italian embroidered tulle embellished with Swarovski crystals and pearls. 
"Representing New Zealand on the world stage wearing the silver fern is always an experience I treasure," said Pascoe, who teamed the dress with a pink and red manicure she got from Polished in Christchurch. 
"I've always had a keen interest in fashion, couture in particular. The level of detail in this dress, for me, makes it a thing of beauty. I love it, it is without a doubt one of the most gorgeous dresses I have ever worn." Grace Millicent Couture 
The gown was made of Italian embroidered tulle embellished with Swarovski crystals and pearls. 
The event put the spotlight on Kiwi design house Grace Millicent, which has also designed a gown for Gemma Flynn. 
"Sophie is an inspirational young woman, and we feel very privileged to have one our country's most successful swimmers in one of our gowns," said the company's creative director Grace Sutherland. 
"Over three hundred hours of work went into creating her dress, and we had a lot of fun in designing a piece that would make a real statement on the red carpet." Dave Rowland 
Sophie Pascoe during the ACC Paralympic Open Day at AUT Millennium last year.
